pullRequest.body:
Add a section about `EReal` in the file `MeasureTheory.Constructions.BorelSpace.Real.lean` with the instances for the measurability of the sum and multiplication between two extended real numbers as well as some lemmas that are needed for the proofs.


---

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I found a more conceptual approach that makes your proofs cleaner. However I just stumbled upon the fact that `MeasureTheory.Constructions.Prod.Basic` meshes the construction of the product measure with results about the product sigma algebra. I will split it first.
@YaelDillies Can you please revert that last commit and leave the PR in a clean state while you are preparing for your possible alternative proof?
Sorry, it was not very clean of me, but I knew the proof was very close and I didn't want to include the diff of #18286 in this PR, so I simply waited a few hours. The new proof is now complete.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17082~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18286~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18287~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18301~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Marking as awaiting-author because it does not build.
Apologies, I didn't see it didn't build. The fix was quite trivial.
I am the author of most of the code Lorenzo PRed (before Yaël's modifications), so I won't review this myself.
Looks good, thanks!
People oscillate between zero and one newlines between section ends, but certainly not two
Done, thanks.

Does `fun_prop` accept lemmas like that?
```suggestion
@[fun_prop]
lemma measurable_of_measurable_real_real {f : EReal × EReal → β}
    (h_real : Measurable fun p : ℝ × ℝ ↦ f (p.1, p.2))
    (h_bot_left : Measurable fun r : ℝ ↦ f (⊥, r))
    (h_top_left : Measurable fun r : ℝ ↦ f (⊤, r))
    (h_bot_right : Measurable fun r : ℝ ↦ f (r, ⊥))
    (h_top_right : Measurable fun r : ℝ ↦ f (r, ⊤)) :
    Measurable f := by
```
It does not seem to work, at least not out of the box (I tried formulating the same lemma as an example, with the same hypotheses and thesis, and fun_prop does not manage to prove it).

I might call that
```suggestion
lemma measurable_of_real_prod {f : EReal × β → γ}
```
instead. Same below
Done, thanks.
You will need to merge master as this lemma name is now linted against
Done, thanks.
... and this instance is already on master
We have merged master. Thanks.
Could you move this to a better place? This has nothing to do with measure theory.
instead of primes, could you use `_left` and `_right`?
This lemma is actually not used here anymore, so I have moved it to branch `measurable_from_prod_countable_right` in case @LorenzoLuccioli or @pitmonticone want to save it

I'm not sure this should be tagged with `fun_prop`: it's not the kind of lemma I would apply in an automatic procedure (and neither `measurable_of_real_real`) because it gives rise to more complicated expressions in a typical situation.
I don't really mind because I guess it won't apply very often, but the reason I tagged it was that it was analogous to `Measurable.of_uncurry_left`/`Measurable.of_uncurry_right`
